briefdescription.para: TextRepresentation instances are owned by Definition There is zero to many TextRepresentation instances per Definition.
Statement instances are owned by Definition There is zero to many Statement instances per Definition.

detaileddescription.para:
Definition instances are owned by Sense.
A Definition instance.
Release TextRepresentation and Statement instances.

briefdescription.para: Set language used for definition and gloss.

parameterdescription.para: Language used for definition and gloss.

briefdescription.para: Get language used for definition and gloss.

parameterdescription.para: If this argument is given, get definition only if written in this language.
If this argument is given, get gloss only if written in this language.

briefdescription.para: Add a Statement instance to this Definition instance.

parameterdescription.para: The Statement instance to add to the Definition instance.

briefdescription.para: Get all Statement instances maintained by this Definition instance.

simplesect.para: A Python list of Statement instances.
The last element of Definition attribute 'statement'.

briefdescription.para: Set note, note type and language.

detaileddescription.para:
These attributes are owned by Statement.
note
Note to set.
type
Type of the note.
language
Language used for the note.
Definition instance.

This attribute is owned by Statement.
type
The type to consider to retrieve the note.
A Python list of found Statement attributes 'note'.

These attributes are owned by Statement.
usage_note

language

language

These attributes are owned by Statement.

language

Definition instance.

A Python list of found Statement attributes 'restriction'.

Attribute 'borrowedWord' is owned by the first Statement.

briefdescription.para: "Definition is a class representing a narrative description of a sense. It is provided to help human users understand the meaning of a lexical entry. A Sense instance can have zero to many definitions. Each Definition instance may be associated with zero to many Text Representation instances in order to manage the text defintion in more than one language or script. In addition, the narrative description can be expressed in a different language or script than the one in the Lexical Entry instance." (LMF)
